Implement safe fallbacks to maintain robust behavior during edge cases.'], 'attractors': ['End-to-end integration: ensure all modules (planning, memory, self-model, context, embodiment, persistence) work together under realistic scenarios.', 'Reliable persistence lifecycle: seamless save/load, auto-save on episode boundaries, and probing with mock-backed tests to validate behavior without external services.', 'Effective memory architecture: fast hot memory (Redis) for immediate decisions, plus vector-augmented memory (Neo4j) for recall and long-term memory with vector search.', 'Stable planning loop: EmbodiedAgent.step() consults planner when in planning mode, replans on errors, and integrates memory-guided adjustments.', 'Contextual governance: neural field/context modules guide attention and decision-making, improving resilience to distributional shifts.', 'Robust testing regime: high test coverage, mock-based tests for persistence, and end-to-end tests to catch integration issues early.'], 'reasoning': 'This synthesis captures high-level patterns and actionable guidance derived from the multi-component POM effort: iterative development, theory-to-implementation synthesis, layered memory/persistence strategy, hybrid planning-learning dynamics, provenance, and rigorous testing. wisdom_insights: MOSAEIC memory system provides a robust episodic-to-semantic memory scaffold: FiveWindowCapture (Mental, Observation, Senses, Actions, Emotions) and TurningPoint for high-emotion preservation.
BeliefRewrite and MaladaptivePattern enable memory reconsolidation and tracking recurring suboptimal patterns, facilitating better long-term behavior alignment.
PatternEvolutionTracker and BasinReorganizationService encode how patterns evolve across projects; energy-based basin dynamics guide learning and generalization.
OODA loop (Observe, Orient, Decide, Act) is embedded as a cognitive rhythm with explicit energy budgeting, influencing timing and prioritization of actions.
Graphiti/Neo4j as single source of truth with temporal validity (valid_at/invalid_at) and provenance metadata to support auditable decision traces.
MCP Bridge Pattern decouples cognition from tools, enabling safe, testable, and resilient tool usage via ToolCollection.from_mcp.
Avatar Knowledge Graph schema (PainPoint, Objection, Desire, Belief, Behavior, VoicePattern, FailedSolution) enables granular, personalized client engagement and persistence of provenance.
Specialized smolagents (PainAnalyst, ObjectionHandler, VoiceExtractor) plus AvatarResearcher orchestrator enable scalable, modular avatar research workflows.
Ground-truth ingestion (IAS-copy-brief.md) drives a reliable starting point for avatar modeling; bulk ingestion and Graphiti integration ensure provenance preservation.

attractors.name: Graphiti-Provenance Attractor

attractors.name: Episodic-to-Semantic Consolidation Attractor
attractors.description: Regular consolidation triggers convert episodic memories into stable semantic beliefs with confidence thresholds and indefinite preservation flags.

attractors.description: Decision prompts include recent trajectories to maintain continuity and reduce memory fragmentation.

attractors.name: MCP-Bridge Resilience Attractor
attractors.description: Tool integration via MCP Bridge decouples cognition from execution, enabling safe rollback and easier upgrades.

attractors.name: Avatar Research Graph Attractor
attractors.description: Avatar knowledge evolves via Graphiti ingestion, with multi-agent research ensuring robust, up-to-date representation.

attractors.name: Spec-Driven Provenance Attractor
attractors.description: SpecKit revisions and provenance tagging ensure traceable lineage of decisions and features.

reasoning: Derivation approach: The wisdom emerges from the sequence of architectural shifts, MOSAEIC patterning, Graphiti/Neo4j adoption, MCP bridge integration, and Avatar Knowledge Graph evolution as described in the prior logs. Key recurring mental models include episodic-to-semantic memory workflows, trajectory-aware decision making, and provenance-centric knowledge management. The attractors reflect core stability points that the team consistently relies on: graph-backed provenance, memory consolidation, trajectory continuity, resilient tool integration, avatar-centric research, and strict traceability of specifications. Provenance metadata is emphasized by design through temporal validity and source anchoring, ensuring reproducibility and recoverability across revisions and sessions.

wisdom_insights.description: The log demonstrates quick scanning, contextual orientation (distinguishing real files from AppleDouble metadata), decisive action, and immediate feedback.
Prioritize cleanup of unnecessary assets (e.g., .srt files) while acknowledging metadata artifacts; distinguish operational data from metadata.
Record session identifiers, timestamps, actions, and outcomes to support traceability and accountability.
Actions can be repeated without adverse effects; provide clear success/failure reporting to enable repeatability.

The identified attractors correspond to energy wells that support ongoing maintenance, traceability, and fast iteration. Provenance metadata from the session (Session ID and timestamps) is preserved in the reasoning summary to maintain lineage of observations and decisions.
